CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 8, 1950, page 54, reads: "Plan 'Town Meeting' Broadcast - The nation's top ranking radio and television forum, 'America's Town Meeting of the Air,' will be broadcast from Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall, April 18 at 8:30 P. M. The broadcast is sponsored by The Pittsburgh Courier as one of the highlights of its fortieth anniversary celebration. The Courier invited a number of Pittsburgh citizens, who represent all facets of community life, to serve as a Host Committee for the broadcast. Mrs. Robert L. Vann, publisher of the Courier, is general chairman, and Mayor David L. Lawrence is honorary chairman. Top photo: Mrs. Vann welcomes some of the committee at a meeting in the Chamber of Commerce last week. Lower photo, left to right, Mayor Lawrence and Mrs. Vann listen, while William Kelly, promotion manager of radio Station WCAE, an ABC outlet, explains details of the scheduled broadcast. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence and Jessie Vann seated on left, as promotion manager of radio station WCAE, William Kelly speaks about "America's Town Meeting of the Air" broadcast at the Chamber of Commerce
